title: The First Epistle of Clement (Clement of Rome)
description: A letter to the church in Corinth, addressing issues of leadership and church order. Historical references within the text suggest a date around AD 96. Manuscript: Codex Alexandrinus (5th century) and other manuscripts

title: The Didache (Teaching of the Twelve Apostles)
description: A manual of church discipline, including teachings on ethics, rituals, and church organization. The content and style of the text, along with historical references, suggest late 1st or early 2nd century. Manuscript:Codex Hierosolymitanus (or Codex H), dated to 1056 AD

title: The Epistle of Barnabas
description: An early Christian work addressing Christian ethics and theology, emphasizing allegorical interpretations of the Old Testament. Internal evidence and thematic elements indicate late 1st or early 2nd century. Manuscript:Codex Sinaiticus (4th century) and other later manuscripts

title: The Epistles of Ignatius of Antioch
description: A series of letters written to various churches, focusing on church unity, hierarchy, and the Eucharist. Historical context places them around AD 110. Manuscript:Various Greek, Latin, and Syriac manuscripts from the 5th century and later

title: The Shepherd of Hermas
description: An apocalyptic text that includes visions, mandates, and parables, emphasizing repentance and discipline. Text's content suggests early to mid-2nd century. Manuscript:Codex Sinaiticus and other fragments

title: The Fragments of Papias
description: Writings on the teachings of Jesus, known from later references, with a focus on oral tradition. Manuscript:

title: The Epistle of Polycarp to the Philippians
description: A letter addressing Christian conduct and warning against heresies. Content and external references suggest early 2nd century. Manuscript:Greek and Latin versions

title: Aristides of Athens
description: Christian apologist known for his Apology addressed to Emperor Hadrian. Referenced by Eusebius and other early sources situate it in the early 2nd century. Manuscript:Armenian and Syriac versions preserved.

title: Dionysius of Corinth
description: Known for letters to various churches. Citations and historical context indicate mid-2nd century. Manuscript:Preserved in quotations by Eusebius and other Church Father.

title: The Writings of Justin Martyr
description: Includes the First Apology, Second Apology, and Dialogue with Trypho, addressing Christian beliefs and defending against pagan criticisms. Historical references and apologetic context date these writings to mid-2nd century. Manuscript:Several Greek manuscripts from the 14th century onwards

title: Polycrates of Ephesus
description: Bishop known for letters concerning Easter controversies. Eusebius and others reference him, situating his letters around the late 2nd century. Manuscript:Fragments preserved in Eusebius' Church History.

title: The Writings of Theophilus of Antioch
description: His work, To Autolycus, is an apologetic text defending Christianity and critiquing pagan beliefs. Manuscript:

title: The Writings of Irenaeus of Lyons
description: His major work, Against Heresies, critiques Gnosticism and establishes early Christian doctrine. Historical references to Gnosticism date these writings to late 2nd century. Manuscript:Latin translations and some Greek fragments

title: The Writings of Athenagoras of Athens
description: Includes A Plea for the Christians and On the Resurrection of the Dead, defending Christian beliefs. Manuscript:

title: Melito of Sardis
description: Known for fragments of homilies and apologies, especially a Paschal Homily. Cited by early church historians and contextual references place his works in the late 2nd century. Manuscript:Various fragments preserved in later writings.

title: Church Father
description: Irenaeus of Lyons, an early church father known for his work "Against Heresies" written around 180 AD.

title: Julius Africanus
description: Historian known for Chronographiae, a chronicle of world history. Historical context and citations by later historians place him in the early 3rd century. Manuscript:Fragments in later chronicles and citations.

title: The Writings of Clement of Alexandria
description: Major works include Exhortation to the Greeks, The Instructor, and Stromata, discussing Christian theology and philosophy. Theological content and references suggest early 3rd century. Manuscript:Greek manuscripts from the 9th century and later

title: The Writings of Tertullian
description: Includes Apology, Against Marcion, and other works addressing heresy, morality, and church practice. Known historical and theological context places them in early 3rd century. Manuscript:Numerous Latin manuscripts from the Middle Ages

title: Caius of Rome
description: Theologian known for fragments against Montanism. Contextual analysis from references in early Christian writings. Manuscript:Fragments preserved in other works by Eusebius.

title: The Writings of Hippolytus of Rome
description: Includes The Refutation of All Heresies and The Apostolic Tradition, focusing on church order and heresy. Manuscript:

title: The Writings of Origen
description: Includes On First Principles, Contra Celsum, and extensive biblical commentaries. Well-documented life and works provide precise early to mid-3rd century dating. Manuscript:Greek and Latin manuscripts from the 4th century onward

title: Commodianus
description: Christian Latin poet, known for Carmen Apologeticum and other works. Linguistic style and thematic content place his works in the mid-3rd century. Manuscript:Latin manuscripts from later periods.

title: The Writings of Novatian
description: Notable for On the Trinity, addressing the nature of God and the Church. Manuscript:

title: The Writings of Cyprian of Carthage
description: Includes On the Unity of the Church, letters, and treatises on church discipline and unity. Historical context situates these works in mid-3rd century. Manuscript:Latin manuscripts from the 4th century onward

title: The Writings of Gregory Thaumaturgus
description: Includes Oration and Panegyric Addressed to Origen, expressing gratitude and theological insights. Manuscript:

title: The Writings of Dionysius of Alexandria
description: Letters and fragments dealing with various theological and pastoral issues. Manuscript:

title: Victorinus of Pettau
description: Known for Commentary on the Apocalypse. Contextual and thematic analysis of his work suggests late 3rd century. Manuscript:Latin manuscripts from the Middle Ages.

title: The Writings of Methodius of Olympus
description: Known for The Banquet of the Ten Virgins, focusing on eschatology and ethics. Manuscript:

title: The Writings of Arnobius of Sicca
description: Includes Against the Heathen, critiquing pagan religion and defending Christianity. Manuscript:

title: The Writings of Lactantius
description: Includes Divine Institutes, addressing Christian doctrine and philosophy. Manuscript:
